subject: Leadership
title: Harriet Tubman and Courage
description: A micro-lesson that makes Harriet Tubman and Courage usable.

hook.text: She escaped slavery, then went back. Thirteen times. Leading over 70 people to freedom on the Underground Railroad.

buildup.text: Tubman's leadership required courage, secrecy, and split-second decisions. One mistake meant death for everyone.

discovery.text: She led by example, walking the same dangerous path she asked others to follow. Trust was earned through shared risk.

twist.text: Tubman also served as a spy and scout for the Union Army. Her leadership extended far beyond the Underground Railroad.

climax.text: Courage means going first into danger. People follow those who share the risk, not those who point the way.

punchline.text: She didn't wait for permission or a title. She just led.

quiz.question: What made Tubman's leadership style effective?
options: She directed from a safe distance
She shared the same risks as those she led
